comment.author: 47572660@N08
comment._content: This appears to have been taken on Cordeaux Road in what is now Kembla Heights. The saddle is between Mount Kembla on the left and the rest of the Illawarra escarpment.

comment.author: 61344864@N08
comment._content: This image was taken from a position off the nothern side of Cordeaux road in an area which is on the Wollongong side of the present Mount Kembla Hotel . The Church which was to become the Soldiers and Miners Memorial Church and was to be realigned from the north- south position as shown in image to a east- west alignment where it still stands .The Church and the other houses were mainly on the southern side of Cordeaux road until the paddock area in image on the northern side of Cordeaux Road  was subdivided into James Road , Stafford Street and  Benjamin Road where it is now part of the Mount Kembla Village . The buildings just below the ridge line on the upper right of the image are part of Kembla Heights along what was Soldiers Road , now Harry Graham Drive  , Cordeaux Road had  a left turn as it neared Kembla Heights and was built up through the lower part of the "saddle back"  which is now Windy Gully and on to the upper Cordeaux River Valley
